page.description: Returns TRUE if the record pointer is at the end of the file.

argument.name: End_Of_File_Flag
argument.description: .T. (TRUE) if the record pointer is at the end of the file for the specified table; otherwise, .F. (FALSE).

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: Optional. Default = the table associated with the current layout. The name of a table.

page.discussion: You may use the EOF() function in a layout. The function returns .T. (TRUE) if the record pointer is at the end of the file for the specified table; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). Note : The <TBL>.FETCH_EOF()method is the easiest way to test for the end of a file.
page.example: dim tbl as P dim i as N dim cnt as N tbl = table.open("Product") cnt = tbl.records_get() tbl.fetch_first() i = 1 statusbar.Percent(i, cnt) while .not. eof("Product") tbl.fetch_next() i = i + 1 statusbar.percent(i,cnt) wend tbl.close()
